org.slf4j.impl
Class AndroidLogger

java.lang.Object
  org.slf4j.helpers.MarkerIgnoringBase
      org.slf4j.impl.AndroidLogger
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Logger
public class AndroidLogger
extends MarkerIgnoringBase

A simple implementation that delegates all log requests to the Google Android logging facilities. Note that this logger does not support Marker. That is, methods taking marker data simply invoke the corresponding method without the Marker argument, discarding any marker data passed as argument.

The logging levels specified for SLF4J can be almost directly mapped to the levels that exist in the Google Android platform. The following table shows the mapping implemented by this logger.

SLF4JAndroid
TRACELog.VERBOSE
DEBUGLog.DEBUG
INFOLog.INFO
WARNLog.WARN
ERRORLog.ERROR

Version:
$Rev:$; $Author:$; $Date:$
Author:
Thorsten Möller
See Also:

getName

public String getName()
Description copied from interface: Logger
Return the name of this Logger instance.

Specified by:
getName in interface Logger

readResolve

protected Object readResolve()
                      throws ObjectStreamException
Replace this instance with a homonymous (same name) logger returned by LoggerFactory. Note that this method is only called during deserialization.

This approach will work well if the desired ILoggerFactory is the one references by LoggerFactory. However, if the user manages its logger hierarchy through a different (non-static) mechanism, e.g. dependency injection, then this approach would be mostly counterproductive.

Returns:
logger with same name as returned by LoggerFactory
Throws:
ObjectStreamException
